results:
Based on the search results, here's information about Andrea Arnold's 2011 film adaptation of "Wuthering Heights":

## Film Overview
Wuthering Heights is a 2011 British Gothic romantic drama film directed by Andrea Arnold starring Kaya Scodelario as Catherine Earnshaw and James Howson as Heathcliff.(no content)The screenplay written by Arnold and Olivia Hetreed, is based on Emily Brontë's 1847 novel of the same name.

## James Howson as First Black Heathcliff
In November, it was reported that James Howson had been cast as Heathcliff, the first time a black actor would portray the role.(no content)With Kaya Scodelario (Skins) and James Howson, the first black actor to play Heathcliff, Brontë's 'dark-skinned gypsy', on screen.

## Casting Process
Due to Brontë's description of Heathcliff as a "dark-skinned gypsy in aspect" and "a little Lascar", Arnold searched for an actor from the UK's Romani community.(no content)The search was then expanded to Yorkshire actors aged 16 to 21 of mixed race, Indian, Pakistani, Bangladeshi or Middle Eastern descent.

## Kaya Scodelario as Catherine
In April, she cast Kaya Scodelario as Catherine, a more age-appropriate choice than previous adaptations.(no content)Kaya Scodelario (Skins) as Cathy and James Howson as Heathcliff lead an impressive British cast in this timeless story of two of the most memorable lovers in literature.

## Film Details
Heathcliff is bullied and "whipped like a slave", and he is played by a multiracial actor which befits the original description of Heathcliff in the book. The film focuses primarily on the childhood and adolescence of Heathcliff and Catherine, with the novel's second half, about the romance between Catherine Linton and Linton Heathcliff, is omitted.

The film received a 69% fresh rating on Rotten Tomatoes, based on 115 reviews, with an average rating of 6.5/10.
